alert.note: Alert for Chester; Decatur; Henderson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 5:40PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Henderson, northeastern Chester and southwestern Decatur Counties through 615 PM CDT... At 539 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Jacks Creek, or 9 miles east of Henderson, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lexington, Sardis, Jacks Creek, Reagan, Scotts Hill, Enville, Warrens Bluff, Rock Hill, Palestine, Roby, Cabo, Middle Fork, Hinson Springs, Taylors Crossing and Shady Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
